results.title: Snowy Mountain Scheme
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
This short film shows the early stages of the Hydro Electric Scheme. Illustrating the difficulties in development and construction through diagrammatic animation. This film was probably shot and completed before the scheme was finished.

results.title: Snowy Mountain riders
results.creator_credit: David Leonard and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
In the Snowy Mountains of southern New South Wales, near Jindabyne, there is to be a horse meeting to honour the first settlers of the district. The film shows the rounding-up and breaking-in of wild brumbies for the picnic race meeting and comments on the change in the district over the years. Narrated by Ron Iddon.

results.title: Snowy '69
results.brief_description: Shows the construction, plans and development of the Snowy Mountain Scheme including the opening ceremony. Photography by Harry Malcolm and narration by James Dibble.

results.title: Snowtown
results.brief_description: Based on true events, 16 year-old Jamie falls in with his mother’s new boyfriend and his crowd of self-appointed neighborhood watchmen, a relationship that leads to a spree of torture and murder.

constellations_other.name: Alice Babidge and True History of the Kelly Gang
constellations_other.description: An acclaimed set, costume, and production designer in the world of theatre, Alice Babidge has most recently been working in film including Justin Kurzel features Snowtown and True History Of The Kelly Gang.

results.title: Snows of Aorangi
results.brief_description: Shows champions Hans Bohny, Harvey Clifford, and Peter Lawlor on a ski run on the slopes of New Zealand’s highest mountain, Mt Cook or Aorangi - “the cloud piercer” as it is known by the Maoris. Includes spectacular scenes of a snow-storm, an avalanche, and strange ice formations.

results.title: Snowpiercer
results.creator_credit: Tomorrow Studios, Studio T, CJ Entertainment, Benjamin Legrand, Jacques Lob, Jean-Marc Rochette, Jiwon Park, MacKenzie Donaldson and Barry Robison
results.brief_description: Set more than seven years after the world has become a frozen wasteland, the remnants of humanity inhabit a gigantic, perpetually-moving train that circles the globe as class warfare, social injustice and the politics of survival play out.

results.title: Snowpiercer
results.creator_credit: CJ Entertainment, Opus Pictures, Stillking Films, SnowPiercer, Moho Film, Union Investment Partners, Steven Nam, Kelly Masterson, Catherine George, Jeong Tae-sung, Benjamin Legrand, Jacques Lob, Jean-Marc Rochette, Bong Joon-ho, Ondrej Nekvasil, Baik, Miky Lee and Jeong Won-jo
results.headline_credit: Czech Republic, South Korea and United States of America, 2013
results.brief_description: In a future where a failed global-warming experiment kills off most life on the planet, a class system evolves aboard the Snowpiercer, a train that travels around the globe via a perpetual-motion engine.

constellations_other.name: There is no Planet B
constellations_other.description: While the climate emergency is very real, inspiring thousands and thousands of students to strike, documentaries, animated movies and dystopian genre films have warned about a world ravaged by global warming.

results.title: Snowdrift at Bleath Gill
results.creator_credit: Kenneth J. Fairbairn, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: A freight train becomes snowbound in the West-Morland hills in Northern England. The Motive Power, Operating and Engineering Departments of British Transport go to work with snow-ploughs to reach the trapped train. Working through the night the team dig clear, and thaw out moving parts, and finally two engines help to clear the line.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kenneth J. Fairbairn, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films

results.title: Snowdonia
results.creator_credit: Richard Guinea, Julia Spark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: Combines ground and serial photography with diagrams to explain the formation of glacial features which characterize the landscape of Snowdonia National Park in northwestern Wales. Shows the results of slate mining and discusses conflict between preservation and electrical development and tourism.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Guinea, Julia Spark and Granada Television International

results.title: Snowdonia
results.creator_credit: Idloes Owen, Horace Shepherd, British Council and Inspiration Pictures (GB)
results.brief_description: Some of the loveliest scenery in Wales; the view from the summit of Snowden, historic Conway Castel, the Swallow Falls. Shots of Caeruaroon Castle include the Kings Gate, the ruined Banqueting Hall and the Eagle Tower where the Welsh flag and the Union Jack fly side by side.
